meanings.definition: Not silent; making noise or sound.
meanings.sent1: The unsilent children were playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The unsilent alarm woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The unsilent birds chirped happily in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The unsilent thunderstorm rumbled through the night.
meanings.sent5: The unsilent fireworks lit up the sky with their crackling sounds.

meanings.definition: To make noise or sound; to speak or express loudly.
meanings.sent1: Please do not unsilent during the movie.
meanings.sent2: She unsilented her excitement when she won the game.
meanings.sent3: The magician unsilented his tricks to the amazed audience.
meanings.sent4: The teacher unsilented the class with an unexpected pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The singer unsilented her powerful voice on stage.

meanings.sent1: The unsilent party next door kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The unsilent traffic outside the window disturbed her concentration.
meanings.sent3: The unsilent dog barked at every passing car.
meanings.sent4: The unsilent construction work echoed through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The unsilent crowd cheered loudly at the sports event.
